body_html:
I succeeded to convert the Out_imgData (ByteBuffer object) into a bitmap.
the solution is:

Out_imgData.rewind();
Bitmap bitmap_out = Bitmap.createBitmap(DIM_IMG_SIZE_X , DIM_IMG_SIZE_Y, Bitmap.Config.ARGB_8888);
int pixel = 0;
int[] intValues_test = new int[DIM_IMG_SIZE_X * DIM_IMG_SIZE_Y];
mBitmapIn.getPixels(intValues_test, 0, mBitmapIn.getWidth(), 0, 0, mBitmapIn.getWidth(), mBitmapIn.getHeight());
int[] pixels = new int[DIM_IMG_SIZE_X * DIM_IMG_SIZE_Y];
for (int i = 0; i < DIM_IMG_SIZE_X * DIM_IMG_SIZE_Y; i++) {
          final int val = intValues_test[pixel++];
          int a = 0xFF;
          float r = Out_imgData.getFloat();
          float g = Out_imgData.getFloat();
          float b = Out_imgData.getFloat();
          pixels[i] = a << 24 | (int)r << 16 | (int)g << 8 | (int)b;
        }
bitmap_out.setPixels(pixels, 0, DIM_IMG_SIZE_X, 0, 0, DIM_IMG_SIZE_X, DIM_IMG_SIZE_Y);
